contentHtml:
Reverse Linked List

You are given the headheadhead of a linked list and must return the reverse of the linked list.

  • 1−2−3−4−51-2-3-4-51−2−3−4−5
  • 5−4−3−2−15-4-3-2-15−4−3−2−1

How to Solve?

With a linked list, assume that the end of the linked list always points to nullnullnull.

1−2−3−4−5−null1-2-3-4-5-null1−2−3−4−5−null

How does this give us a hint to the solution?

Linked List

Well, imagine if we have two previous and current pointers where the previous pointer equals nullnullnull and the current pointer equals headheadhead.

head list
h 1
2
3
4
5

Intuitively, we need to set head to where 555 is at.

1−2−3−4−51-2-3-4-51−2−3−4−5

Imagine we have three pointers instead of two:

  • nxt=Nonenxt = Nonenxt=None
    • Temporary variable to store the next value.
  • prev=Noneprev = Noneprev=None
    • Starts at nullnullnull
  • curr=headcurr = headcurr=head
    • Starts at headheadhead

nxt prev curr head list

      • curr.next=2curr.next = 2curr.next=2
  • curr.next=>prevcurr.next=>prevcurr.next=>prev
    • curr=headcurr = headcurr=head
      • or 111
    • prev=nullprev = nullprev=null
      • or 000
  • prev=1prev = 1prev=1
    • prev=currprev = currprev=curr
  • curr=2curr = 2curr=2
    • curr=nxtcurr = nxtcurr=nxt

  • prev=2prev = 2prev=2

  • nxt=nullnxt = nullnxt=null
    • nxt=curr.nextnxt = curr.nextnxt=curr.next

  • curr.next=>prevcurr.next=>prevcurr.next=>prev
    • curr=headcurr = headcurr=head
      • or 555

nxt prev curr head list

Notice how both currcurrcurr and nxtnxtnxt equal to nullnullnull. Therefore, we must return prevprevprev since it is now equal to 555 which was the end of the original linked list. In this case, currcurrcurr also becomes nullnullnull effectively ending the whilewhilewhile loop.

Helpful Hints

  • How do I get the next value in a linked list?
    • x.nextx.nextx.next
  • Store a temporary variable for the nextnextnext value in a linked list.

Linked List Solution

# Definition for singly-linked list.
# class ListNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.next = next
class Solution:
    def reverseList(self, head: Optional[ListNode]) -> Optional[ListNode]:
        # Set previous to null
        prev = None
        # Set nxt to null
        nxt = None
        # Set curr to head
        curr = head

        # Keep running until curr is null
        while curr:
            # Store the next value in a temp variable
            nxt = curr.next
            # Curr needs to point to the previous value
            curr.next = prev
            # Set previous value to current value
            prev = curr
            # Set current value to next value
            # For next iteration
            curr = nxt
        
        # Return prev as it is equal to the end of
        # The linked list before we reversed it.
        # AKA, it is the new head
        return prev
title: Reverse Linked List
